description: Documentation for 9.7.13.15.5. Tracking asynchronous operations by the mbarrier object

files.title: Overview
files.summary: Starting with the Hopper architecture (`sm_9x`), *mbarrier object* supports a new count, called *tx-count*, which is used for tracking the completion of asynchronous memory operations or transactions. *tx-count* tracks the number of asynchronous transactions, in units specified by the asynchronou...

files.title: 9.7.13.15.5.1. expect-tx operation
files.summary: The *expect-tx* operation, with an `expectCount` argument, increases the *tx-count* of an *mbarrier object* by the value specified by `expectCount`. This sets the current phase of the *mbarrier object* to expect and track the completion of additional asynchronous transactions.
